message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The description of the physical features suggests that the newborn has Down syndrome. Among the options given, atrioventricular septal defect is the most common cardiac anomaly associated with Down syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The newborn is exhibiting physical features consistent with Down syndrome, and among the options, atrioventricular septal defects are commonly associated with Down syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The features described are consistent with Down syndrome. Atrioventricular septal defect is commonly associated with Down syndrome. The other options are less commonly associated with Down syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The clinical features described in the newborn, including the sloping forehead, flat nasal bridge, increased interocular distance, low-set ears, protruding tongue, single palmar crease, increased gap between the first and second toe, and small white and brown spots in the periphery of both irises, are consistent with Down syndrome. The abdominal distension and large air-filled spaces on x-ray suggest duodenal atresia, a common co-occurring condition in individuals with Down syndrome. Atrioventricular septal defect is the most common cardiac anomaly associated with Down syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest Down syndrome and the distended abdomen indicates a gastrointestinal abnormality. Among the options, atrioventricular septal defect (AVSD) is the most commonly associated cardiac anomaly with Down syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The description of the newborn's physical characteristics suggests that he has Down syndrome. Down syndrome is commonly associated with atrioventricular septal defects, so the correct answer is (B). Atrial septal defects, tetralogy of Fallot, and ventricular septal defects are not commonly associated with Down syndrome.

Down syndrome is most commonly associated with atrioventricular septal defects.
